info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 2 at 1:05AM AKDT until November 2 at 4:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL NEAR WHITE PASS...
.A front moving through tonight is bringing light to moderate snow to the far northern panhandle. The advisory has been extended in time until early Sunday morning with a slower arrival of the front. The heaviest snow will be at higher elevations near White Pass into early Sunday morning. Snowfall rates will diminish through Sunday.
* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to three inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph.
* WHERE...Higher elevations along the Klondike Highway, especially near White Pass.
* WHEN...Until 4 AM AKDT early this morning.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...|Up to moderate snowfall rates are expected to continue into tonight. Snowfall rates will taper down through Sunday.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.
People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT EARLY THIS MORNING
